section.title: Installing the Cloud Controller
section.para: Install the messaging queue server. The OpenStack services talk to each other using AMQP(Advanced Message Queue Protocol) by communicating with a message server.
On Ubuntu, the messaging queue server that's most tested is RabbitMQ. This is the default message server so no additional configuration is needed if you use this server.

On Fedora, RHEL, and CentOS, the most tested messaging server is Apache Qpid. Refer to the Compute Administration Manual for configuration instructions, including adding rpc_backend=nova.rpc.impl_qpid to your nova.conf.
section.screen: sudo yum install openstack-utils memcached qpid-cpp-server
section.para: Install the required nova- packages, and dependencies are automatically installed.
section.screen: sudo apt-get install nova-compute nova-volume nova-vncproxy nova-api nova-ajax-console-proxy nova-cert nova-consoleauth nova-doc nova-scheduler nova-network
